medical_history.chief_complaint: Abrupt onset severe abdominal pain after eating, leading to chest pressure/pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The abdominal pain started shortly after the patient finished eating pancakes in the evening. Initially very severe and located in the epigastrium, it made breathing difficult. By the time the patient arrived at the hospital, the abdominal pain had subsided but he experienced chest pressure/pain. The patient also reported nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Atrial fibrillation on coumadin, Asthma/COPD, diastolic CHF with EF 55%, community-acquired pneumonia, Hypertension, Cervical spondylosis and back pain (on narcotics), Migraine headaches, Right hip fracture (s/p replacement), Peripheral neuropathy, Obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) on CPAP.
medical_history.family_history: Mother lived until old age with no significant illnesses; Father died in a fire; Brother had a myocardial infarction at an unspecified age; Father had a myocardial infarction in an unspecified time frame; No other cardiovascular disease known.
